p: Similar to 6-h results, both 10 and 20 µM DCVC treatment for 12 h caused significant differential gene expression with substantial overlap. For example, the 15 genes that met both criteria (FDR < 0.05 + logFC > 0.35 [FC > 1.3]) for significant differential gene expression with 10 µM DCVC, were also differentially expressed with 20 µM (Fig. 4b). Additionally, 10 µM DCVC treatment yielded 17 differentially expressed genes that met FDR < 0.05 criterion only, and 373 genes had a logFC magnitude difference > 0.35 [FC > 1.3] only (Fig. 4c, Suppl. Table 4). Compared to 10 µM, 20 µM DCVC treatment increased the number of genes with altered expression, yielding 526 differentially expressed genes that met FDR < 0.05 criterion only, 436 genes with a logFC magnitude difference > 0.35 [FC > 1.3] only, and 301 genes that met both criteria (Fig. 4d, Suppl. Table 4). Among the genes that met both criteria, 113 were upregulated and 188 were downregulated. The three genes with the largest magnitude logFC included, inhibin subunit beta ( INHBE) (3.71 logFC [13 FC], FDR = 3.00 × 10 –04), CHAC1 (2.55 logFC [5.9 FC], FDR = 1.25 × 10 –09) and sodium- and chloride-dependent glycine transporter 1 ( SLC6A9) (1.81 logFC [3.0 FC], FDR = 5.46 × 10 –04) (Suppl. Table 4). Although more downregulated genes met both FDR and logFC criteria, the upregulated genes had larger magnitude differential gene expression.
